content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 31 Oct 2018Anyone has recommended ways of securing foreign currencies at better rates?DBS multicurrency account seems like a good idea, but when comparisons are made, some money changers have better rates.2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 01 Nov 2018RHB bank (surprisingly) came up with something similar to youtrip called travel fx. Signed up at a roadshow earlier this week St vivo, kyc done on the spot and got a free sbux card. Can consider this as an alternative if you don't need to change fx to remit funds 0 comments0

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 31 Oct 2018Check out YouTrip which offers 24/7 in-app money changer for 10 currencies."With the YouTrip app, you can exchange and store up to 10 different currencies so you can lock-down a good rate when you see one. Itâ€™s convenient and easy too, with money exchange done with just one-swipe on the app."https://www.you.co/en-SG/blog/everything-you-need-to-know-about-youtrip/0 comments0
